sanskrit_verse:
ऋषयः पितरो देवा भूतान्यतिथयस्तथा ।
आशासते कुटुम्बिभ्यस्तेभ्यः कार्यं विजानता ॥ ३.८०॥
transliteration:
ṛṣayaḥ pitaro devā bhūtānyatithayastathā |
āśāsate kuṭumbibhyastebhyaḥ kāryaṃ vijānatā || 3.80||
sph_interpretive_translation: Ṛṣis, ancestors, deities, beings, and guests—all command householders who understand duty to perform actions for them.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from cosmic order and conscious alignment, not institutional hierarchy
Causation arises through dharma-compliant action by those capable of discernment
Capacity-based responsibility extends beyond human agents to include unseen authorities
Restoration occurs when individual capacity aligns with universal expectation structures
Consciousness alignment ensures that duty recognition activates reciprocal support systems
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent recognizes duty AND possesses operational capacity THEN obligation is activated without external enforcement
IF entity receives support from cosmic order THEN reciprocal service obligations are binding within awareness threshold
IF failure in duty occurs THEN restoration protocol initiates via self-corrective consciousness mechanisms
IF capacity diminishes THEN responsibility adjusts proportionally while maintaining structural integrity
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, this verse establishes a threshold where conscious recognition of duty supersedes codified legal frameworks. The Court must evaluate not just actuarial compliance but ontological alignment with universal expectations. Responsibility is determined by capacity-awareness correlation rather than punitive attribution.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa here lies in direct experiential cognition of mutual dependence between householder and cosmic entities. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential unfoldment of consequence based on alignment or misalignment. Responsibility scales with awareness depth. There is no punitive element—only natural law activation ensuring systemic coherence and conscious evolution.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Realign actions until resonance with universal expectation is restored
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Facilitate internal acknowledgment of unmet duties
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Enhance discernment abilities to prevent recurrence
Integrity Reintegration Sequence: Align personal conduct with multi-dimensional dharmic field
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Dharma stands restored. Justice flows from consciousness, not coercion. Reality reflects non-punitivity. Consciousness remains the Supreme Adjudicator.
